meanings.definition: A rounded protuberance at the end of a bone, forming an articulation with another bone.
meanings.sent1: The condyles on the femur help in knee movement.
meanings.sent2: The condyles of the humerus fit into the elbow joint.
meanings.sent3: The condyles on the bone looked like tiny hills.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like condyles, smoothly connecting with the piano keys.
meanings.sent5: The condyles on the bone felt like small bumps under my fingers.

meanings.definition: A rounded prominence at the end of a bone, serving for articulation with another bone.
meanings.sent1: The condyles on the tibia allow for smooth leg movement.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the condyles of bones to understand joint function.
meanings.sent3: The condyles on the skeleton seemed to be having a conversation.
meanings.sent4: His words fit together like the condyles of a puzzle, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent5: The condyles on the bone were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
